page.title: 01Eastleach Turville
page.content: Most of the gently undulating fields around the village are under cereal cultivation. The fields are large (even 100 acres) & bounded by dry stone walls. A local feature are the plantations of beech. In Macaroni Wood the concealed nissen huts of the second world war are currently put to a variety of uses - for furniture restoration & temporary accommodation for youth groups such as guides or deprived urban children. Eastleach Turville itself is where recent expansion of the village, known simply as Eastleach, has happened. Here are the post-war council houses and the old people's bungalows as well as the converted premesis of the one time butcher, baker and blacksmith. The Victorian farmhouse is now a series of flats, and what was the farm complex of older barns and stockpens, a smart
